content: Hey guys, I'm Jimi Sanchez, just wanted to introduce myself. I just got out of a 3 day intensive CDA/FHIR+CDA training class with @Rick Geimer and @Eric Parapini. Really excited to be starting FHIR based projects instead of just v2.x :D

Hi ppl, I'm VÃ­ctor-Polo de Gyves. I'm collaborating with Koneksys on RDF+Linked Data and OSLC adapters. Nice to see that FHIR is close to Linked Data and RDF. By the way I see that on the documentation the REST part is marked as TODO. Maybe we can help on that part as we have already experience developing RDF REST endpoints.
@Victor, you had me at Hi.... and lost me at OSLC adapters :P
There is no golden hammer, OSLC isn't meant to be used for anything
but with regards of linked data+rdf, we had a previous project on EHR which indeed seem to better take advantage on RDF's representation of resources and ontologies

@Victor, you had me at Hi.... and lost me at OSLC adapters :P

Would like to hear your impressions on OSLC! how did you used it?
